messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] comparing products
messages.msgSnippet: You know as I was washing the dishes tonight I thought the same thing and was just sitting down to say so... anyone who would like to discuss this topic
messages.messageBody:
You know as I was washing the dishes tonight I thought the same thing and
was just sitting down to say so... anyone who would like to discuss this
topic further - info or debate please contact me offlist @
dragteine@....


Shannon
Melaleuca Customer

Join our club and swap paperback books for FREE - PaperBackSwap.com

-----Original Message-----
From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Ren Allen
Sent: Friday, February 24, 2006 7:56 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] comparing products

" My mother and sister are chemical sensitive. Often
the problem is low quality ingredients - even in all natural products
if the essential oil has been through a third processing often they
use a chemical to do it. "


The problem is not just "low quality ingredients"!!! People can have
toxic reactions to completely natural, high quality products. Knowing
your own body is the only way to really be healthy.

As much as a debate on healthy vs. toxic would interest me, it is not
appropriate for this list! The choices we make in relation to
unschooling are fine, but this is spinning way off and I am asking it
to stop now.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
